channel.title: $3,000 Computer?
channel.description:
I want to build a really good Gaming Computer, that's super fast and can run any game. My Budget is $3,000 AUD. Please tell me where to buy parts and what are the best parts.
Thanks.

item.title: $3,000 Computer?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:

http://www.techbuy.com.au

Enjoy!

item.title: $3,000 Computer?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:20, topic:448185”][quote author=t4 link=topic=551076.msg4039383#msg4039383 date=1341456279]
protip: don’t buy extreme intel procs, just overclock
[/quote]
Or don’t and you wont void your warranty or run the 5% chance of messing something up. Overclocking is only like 5-10 more fps anyway, and you have to get better cooling.[/quote]
As long as you don’t do anything incredibly retarded, you won’t void your warranty. afaik only turning voltage intake up will actually void warranty.

FPS? who gives a dick about FPS, I’m talking about data crunching.

Better cooling? Uhhh… not necessary, it really depends on the thermal specs of the processor and the extent of the overclock.

Read full topic

item.title: $3,000 Computer?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

t4:

protip: don’t buy extreme intel procs, just overclock

Or don’t and you wont void your warranty or run the 5% chance of messing something up. Overclocking is only like 5-10 more fps anyway, and you have to get better cooling.

Read full topic

item.title: $3,000 Computer?
item.dc:creator: @holysab holysab
item.description:
@holysab wrote:

I’d personally SLI a couple of 690’s and get a motherboard(I dont really know much about the current motherboards lol but whatever) like 16gigs of ram(8 would probably do honestly), an ,7(like the guy above said, fuck the extreme ones) and uhh maybe a 2tb hdd and like a 128mb sdd for the OS, probably like a 1200w psu, and uhm a blu-ray burner and yeah

That might be more than $3000

Read full topic

item.title: $3,000 Computer?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:14, topic:448185”][quote author=Frell link=topic=551076.msg4039057#msg4039057 date=1341430258]

If he has a $3k limit all he needs to do is buy the most recent everything… and boom hes 50 years ahead of consoles

Are you still mad about consoles because games consoles has nothing to do with this thread.

No you’re just over complicating PC’s because of your biased opinion on consoles. Just because you dont understand them and would rather plug in two cables and be done and happy don’t make it look like hard work to him.

I bought an HP ATX computer and swapped out the card case and psu, and can run pretty much everything on ultra.
[/quote]
Dafuq?? AS I’VE SAID 500MILLIONZILLIONTIMES I prefer PCs, last time I played on my xbox was about 5 days ago and in those five days I’ve played on my PC 3 times so its pretty clear which I prefer >.>. My real opinion had nothing to do with what I was arguing in the last thread -.- you are an idiot I swear, I’m not even going to reply to the rest of your post. :fp: But you can check the previous dated posts in that thread which state I prefer the PC more if you want but seriously??[/quote]
reading your replies has caused me to experience severe head trauma. please refrain from abusing emoticons and grammar in the future. thank you.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

^I know, but he’s just going on what other people reccomend and people reccomend whats good for them which may not be good for him. Just cause he has $3k to spend doesn’t need he needs a woah PC, he just needs to have one thats good for his uses and the excess money can be spent on w.e.
I’m sure for $1.3k usd he can get everything he wants lol (Not sure about the money conversation ratio do i’m just saying usd) which means he’s got $1.7k left to spend on w.e. he wants.
